block.p: The National Advertising Review Council in New York, the advertising industry's self-regulation organization, said yesterday that it had named Walter O'Brien to the new position of president as part of efforts to increase visibility for the council and its activities.

Mr. O'Brien, 59, was most recently executive client services director at Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide in New York, a unit of the WPP Group. Before that he worked for a sibling WPP agency, the J. Walter Thompson Company in New York, where he rose through the ranks to become a vice chairman.

The National Advertising Review Council in New York, the advertising industry's self-regulation organization, said yesterday that it had named Walter O'Brien to the new position of president as part of efforts to increase visibility for the council and its activities.

Mr. O'Brien, 59, was most recently executive client services director at Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide in New York, a unit of the WPP Group. Before that he worked for a sibling WPP agency, the J. Walter Thompson Company in New York, where he rose through the ranks to become a vice chairman.

The organization includes members from the American Advertising Federation, the American Association of Advertising Agencies, the Association of National Advertisers and the Council of Better Business Bureaus. Mr. O'Brien will also serve as a vice president of the bureaus council. THE MEDIA BUSINESS: ADVERTISING -- ADDENDA
